question: The cost of 16 packets of salt, each weighing 900 grams is Rs.28. What will be the cost of 27 packets, if each packet weighs 1 kg?
A man owns 2/3 of the market research bureau business and sells 3/4 of his shares for Rs.75000. What is the total value of the business?
solution:
3/4 of his shares = 75000

Total value of his shares
	= 75000*4/3
	= 1,00,000
2/3 of total value = 100000

Total value
	= 100000*3/2
	= Rs.1,50,000

question: If x=2y=3z and xyz=36 then what is the value of x?
A sum of money compounded annually amounts to thrice itself in 3 years. In how many years will it become 9 times at the same rate of interest?
If a man buys 1 liter of milk for Rs.12 and mixes it with 20% water and sells it at a price of Rs.15 per liter, then what is the gain%?
solution:
After mixing 20% water,
	he has 1.2 liters of milk.

He sells it at a price of
	15*1.2 = 18
Gain = 18-12 = Rs.6

Gain% = (6/12)*100 = 50%

question: The product of two positive fractions is 6/35 and their quotient is 15/14. The smaller fraction is

Find the sum of the first 20 terms of the sequence 
      2,6,10,14,....
solution:
The sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic progression is
	Sn = (n/2)*[2a+(n-1)d]
n=20
a=2
d=4

S20 = 10[4+(19*4)]
       = 800

question: If one edge of a 6-inch ruler is to be marked in 1/10 inch units, how many marks will there be on the edge including the 0 and 6 inch marks?
solution:
The marks are at
	0, 1/10, 2/10, 3/10,............, 6

Hence, there are 61 marks including 0 and 6 inch marks.

question: The diameter of a circle P is one third the diameter of another circle Q. By how many times is the area of the circle Q greater than the area of the circle P?
solution:
d1 = (1/3) d2

2r1 = 2r2/3

r2 = 3r1

Area of circle P = πr1²

Area of circle Q
	= πr2²
	= π(3r1)²
	= 9 πr1²
